newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Giordano plunges after placement flops.
newsitem.headline: Giordano plunges after placement flops.

text.p: Giordano International Ltd shares plunged in early trade on Friday after the company said a planned placement of new shares with mainland Chinese companies had flopped as the five comapnies failed to complete the deal.
The clothing retailer's shares dropped HK$0.95 to HK$4.20 in first 10 minutes of trade then steadied at HK$4.375.
Volume was 1.28 million shares worth HK$5.92 million.
"Investors are selling the stock following the bad news as Giordano's future development in China is uncertain after the five Chinese investors failed to take up the placement," one broker said.
Giordano had planned to issue 40 million new shares, or 5.3 percent of the enlarged capital, to the five enterprises at HK$4.90 a share.
But the subscribers "failed to perform their obligations to proceed to completion of the placing", the company said in a statement published on Friday.
Unfavourable rumours on the retailer's expansion in China had dampened sentiment since August 1994 when its flagship mainland store in Beijing was closed down by Chinese authorities, brokers said.

The authorities said the closure was related to licensing problems, but analysts widely attributed the move as a reaction to unflattering comments about Chinese Premier Li Peng made by Giordano founder Jimmy Lai.
"Buyers came in at below HK$4.40 and the stock should stablise above HK$4.00 later today," said Michael Ng, dealing director at Sassoon Securities.
